alert.note: Alert for Borden; Howard; Martin; Mitchell; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 10:29PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Scurry, Mitchell, eastern Borden, Howard and southeastern Martin Counties through 1115 PM CST... At 1029 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Lake Alan Henry to 7 miles northwest of Colorado City Airport to 7 miles southeast of Sand Springs to near Forsan. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Snyder, Colorado City, Stanton, Coahoma, Loraine, Forsan, Sand Springs, Lomax, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Inadale, Luther, Fluvanna, Colorado City Airport, J B Thomas Reservoir, Champion Creek Reservoir, Westbrook, Cuthbert and Dunn. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 152 and 228. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
